The movie stars Phill Lewis as Jan Tucker, one of the world's most sought after private detectives.
2. "The Equalizer" (2014): This movie follows the story of a former detective who uses his skills and resources to fight against injustice for those who can't. The movie stars Denzel Washington as Jack Shepherd, a former detective who uses his skills and resources to fight against injustice for those who can't.

Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "What If...?" as one of your movie recommendations options.

The movie is titled "What If...?", which implies that the story revolves around a hypothetical situation. 

As per the plot summary provided, the movie seems to be about exploring the concept of fate and how it shapes our lives. The story revolves around a young man who goes for a stroll and meets the love of his life. However, the movie is not solely focused on the romantic aspect of the story but also delves into deeper philosophical questions such as the nature of reality, free will, and determinism. 

Overall, "What If...?" seems to be a movie that explores various philosophical and existential themes. It may be worth checking out if you are interested in movies that delve into complex philosophical issues.

Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend the movie 'The Sixth Sense'. 

This film, directed by M. Night Shyamalan, stars M. Night Shyamalan as Malcolm Crowe, a child psychologist, who starts treating a young boy, Cole, who encounters dead people and convinces him to help them. 

In turn, Cole helps Malcolm reconcile with his estranged wife. 

The film has been praised for its emotional impact and the way it challenges our assumptions about the world around us.
